title: Application
description: The details related to the application that the interaction is being generated by.  Here application refers to a a software experience (such as a mobile application or desktop application) that can be installed, run, closed, uninstalled by the end user.  This is not intended to describe agents such as chatbots, browser-based plugins, or other experiences that do not follow this lifecycle.

xdm:crashes.description: Triggered when the application does not exit gracefully. Event is sent on application launch after a crash.

xdm:featureUsages.description: Activation(s) of an application feature that is being measured.

xdm:installs.description: Install of an application on a device where the actual install event is available.

xdm:firstLaunches.description: Triggered on first launch after install.

xdm:launches.description: Launch of an application. Triggered on every run, including crashes and installs. Also triggered on a resume from background when the lifecycle session timeout has been exceeded.

xdm:upgrades.description: Upgrade of an application that has previously been installed. Triggered on first launch after upgrade.
